summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to an attorney named Jack, forwarding a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan. The order reminds counsel in the United States v. Maxwell case to comply with local court rules regarding the handling of sensitive materials, as the indictment has been expanded.

persons.name: Jack
persons.context: The email is addressed to Jack, an attorney, reminding him and his colleagues to comply with a court order and local rules in the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Issued the attached order in the United States v. Maxwell case, which is being forwarded to counsel.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Sender of the email, working in the Southern District of New York, forwarding Judge Nathan's order to attorney Jack.

connections.description: The prosecutor is communicating a court order and legal reminder to the attorney, indicating a professional legal context.
Judge Nathan's order applies to Jack as counsel in the case, establishing a judge-attorney relationship.

events.title: Judge Nathan Issues Order on Local Rule Compliance
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issued an order regarding compliance with SDNY Local Rule 23.1 for attorneys in the United States v. Maxwell case.

events.title: Prosecution Forwards Court Order to Counsel
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails attorney Jack to forward Judge Nathan's order, noting it now applies to all attorneys due to an expanded indictment.

keyFacts: The indictment in United States v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) has been expanded, triggering the application of a prior court order to all attorneys in the case.
Judge Alison J. Nathan issued an order on July 23, 2020, reminding counsel to comply with SDNY Local Rule 23.1 regarding the handling of case materials.
The communication is a procedural reminder from the prosecution to defense counsel about adhering to local court rules.
